      • build

        public TransportOptions build​()
        This creates a TransportOptions instance.
        Returns:
        A finished TransportOptions.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the configuration fails validation.

      • getBatchSize

        public Integer getBatchSize​()
        Returns:
        the currently set batchSize.
        See Also:
        setBatchSize(int)

      • setBatchSize

        public TransportOptions.Builder setBatchSize​(int batchSize)
        This determines that maximum number of events that get sent to the Honeycomb server (via a batch request). In other words, this is a trigger that will cause a batch request to be created if a batch reaches this maximum size.

        Also see setBatchTimeoutMillis(long), as that might cause batch request to be created earlier (triggering on time rather than space).

        Note: Events are grouped into batches that have the same write key, dataset name and API host. See EventData.setWriteKey(String), EventData.setDataset(String), and EventData.setApiHost(URI).

        Parameters:
        batchSize - to set.
        Returns:
        this.

      • getBatchTimeoutMillis

        public Long getBatchTimeoutMillis​()
        Returns:
        the currently set batchTimeoutMillis.
        See Also:
        setBatchTimeoutMillis(long)

      • setBatchTimeoutMillis

        public TransportOptions.Builder setBatchTimeoutMillis​(long batchTimeoutMillis)
        If batches do no fill up to the batch size in time (as defined by setBatchSize(int)), then this timeout will trigger a batch request to the Honeycomb server. Essentially, for batches that fill slowly, this ensures that there is a temporal upper bound to when events are sent via a batch request. The time is measured in milliseconds.

        Note: Events are grouped into batches that have the same write key, dataset name and API host. See EventData.setWriteKey(String), EventData.setDataset(String), and EventData.setApiHost(URI).

        Default: 100

        Parameters:
        batchTimeoutMillis - to set.
        Returns:
        this.

      • getQueueCapacity

        public Integer getQueueCapacity​()
        Returns:
        the currently set queueCapacity.
        See Also:
        setQueueCapacity(int)

      • setQueueCapacity

        public TransportOptions.Builder setQueueCapacity​(int queueCapacity)
        This sets the capacity of the queue that events are submitted to before they get processed for batching and eventually sent to the honeycomb HTTP endpoint.

        Under normal circumstances this queue should remain near empty, but in case of heavy load it acts as a bounded buffer against a build up of backpressure from the batching and http client implementation.

        Default: 10000

        Parameters:
        queueCapacity - to set.
        Returns:
        this.
        See Also:
        ClientRejected.RejectionReason.QUEUE_OVERFLOW, BatchConsumer.consume(java.util.List)

      • getMaximumPendingBatchRequests

        public Integer getMaximumPendingBatchRequests​()
        Returns:
        the currently set maxPendingBatchRequests
        See Also:
        BatchConsumer.consume(java.util.List)

      • setMaximumPendingBatchRequests

        public TransportOptions.Builder setMaximumPendingBatchRequests​(int maximumPendingBatchRequests)
        This determines the maximum number of batch requests that can be still pending completion at any one time. Set to -1 if there is no maximum, i.e. the number of batch requests pending completion is allowed to grow without bound.

        Once a batch request has been triggered (see setBatchSize(int) and setBatchTimeoutMillis(long)), then the batch request is submitted to BatchConsumer.consume(java.util.List).

        If the maximum pending requests is reached, then BatchConsumer.consume(java.util.List) may block until the number of pending requests has dropped below the threshold.

        This allows backpressure to be created if the BatchConsumer implementation cannot keep up with the number of batch requests being submitted. The intended consequence of this is that the event queue may reach its capacity and overflow.

        See setQueueCapacity(int).

        This configuration differs from getMaxConnections() in that a batch request may be pending completion, but it may be still be waiting for an HTTP connection. This is the case in the default HoneycombBatchConsumer where the HttpAsyncClient maintains an internal unbounded pending queue for requests that are waiting for a connection. This configuration effectively puts a bound on the total number of batch requests being serviced by the HTTP client, regardless of whether they have a connection or not.

        Default: 250

        Parameters:
        maximumPendingBatchRequests - to set.
        Returns:
        this.
        See Also:
        setMaxConnections(int)

      • getMaxConnections

        public int getMaxConnections​()
        Returns:
        the currently set maxConnections.
        See Also:

      • setMaxConnections

        public TransportOptions.Builder setMaxConnections​(int maxConnections)
        Set this to define the maximum amount of connections the http client may hold in its connection pool. In effect this is the maximum level of concurrent HTTP requests that may be in progress at any given time.

        Default: 200

        Parameters:
        maxConnections - to set.
        Returns:
        this.
        See Also:
        HttpAsyncClientBuilder.setMaxConnTotal(int)

      • getMaxConnectionsPerApiHost

        the currently set maxConnectionsPerApiHost.
        See Also:
        setMaxConnectionsPerApiHost(int)

      • setMaxConnectionsPerApiHost

        public TransportOptions.Builder setMaxConnectionsPerApiHost​(int maxConnectionsPerApiHost)
        Set this to define the maximum amount of connections the http client may hold in its connection pool for a given hostname. In effect this limits how many concurrent requests may be sent to a single host.

        Default: 100

        Parameters:
        maxConnectionsPerApiHost - to set.
        Returns:
        this.
        See Also:
        HttpAsyncClientBuilder.setMaxConnPerRoute(int)

      • setConnectTimeout

        public TransportOptions.Builder setConnectTimeout​(int connectTimeout)
        Set this to define the http client's connect timeout in milliseconds. Set to 0 for no timeout.

        Default: 0

        Parameters:
        connectTimeout - to set.
        Returns:
        this.
        See Also:
        RequestConfig.getConnectTimeout()

      • getConnectionRequestTimeout

        public int getConnectionRequestTimeout​()
        Returns:
        the currently set connectionRequestTimeout.
        See Also:
        setConnectionRequestTimeout(int)

      • setConnectionRequestTimeout

        public TransportOptions.Builder setConnectionRequestTimeout​(int connectionRequestTimeout)
        Set this to define the http client's connection request timeout in milliseconds. This defines the maximum time that a batch request can wait for a connection from the connection manager after submission to the HTTP client. Set to 0 for no timeout.

        Beware that setting this to a non-zero value might conflict with the backpressure effect of the BatchConsumer implementation, and so might see an increase in failed batches. See setMaximumPendingBatchRequests(int) for more detail.

        Default: 0

        Parameters:
        connectionRequestTimeout - to set.
        Returns:
        this.
        See Also:
        RequestConfig.getConnectionRequestTimeout()

      • getSocketTimeout

        Returns:

        See Also:
        setSocketTimeout(int)

      • setSocketTimeout

        public TransportOptions.Builder setSocketTimeout​(int socketTimeout)
        Set this to define the http client's socket timeout in milliseconds. Set to 0 for no timeout.

        Default: 3000

        Parameters:
        socketTimeout - to set.
        Returns:
        this.
        See Also:
        RequestConfig.getSocketTimeout()

      • getIoThreadCount

        See Also:

      • setIoThreadCount

        public TransportOptions.Builder setIoThreadCount​(int ioThreadCount)
        Set this to define the http client's io thread count. This is usually set to the number of CPU cores.

        Default: System CPU cores.

        Parameters:
        ioThreadCount - to set, must be between 1 and the system's number of CPU cores.
        Returns:
        this.
        See Also:
        Apache http client NIO, IOReactorConfig.getIoThreadCount()

      • getMaximumHttpRequestShutdownWait

        public Long getMaximumHttpRequestShutdownWait​()
        Returns:
        the currently set maximumHttpRequestShutdownWait.
        See Also:
        setMaximumHttpRequestShutdownWait(long)

      • setMaximumHttpRequestShutdownWait

        public TransportOptions.Builder setMaximumHttpRequestShutdownWait​(long maximumHttpRequestShutdownWait)
        Defines the maximum time (in milliseconds) that we should wait for any pending HTTP requests to complete during the client shutdown process.

        Any requests that are still pending at the end of this wait period will be terminated.

        Default: 2000

        Parameters:
        maximumHttpRequestShutdownWait - to set.
        Returns:
        this.
